text: The 2021–22 season was the 89th season for the Austrian football club FC Red Bull Salzburg. They won the double (championship and cup). In the UEFA Champions League they reached the round of 16 for the first time in history. ==Squad== * Goalkeepers:33 Alexander Walke,1 Cican Stankovic, 23Nico Mantl * Defenders: 95 Bernardo, 17 Andreas Ulmer, 25 Patrick Farkas, 43 Rasmus Kristensen, 5 Albert Vallci, 39 Maximilian Wöber, 22 Oumar Solet, 70 Amar Dedic, * Midfielders: 45 Enock Mwepu, 16 Zlatko Junuzovic, 21 Luka Sucic 28 Antoine Bernède, 19 Mohamed Camara, 77 Noah Okafor, 13 Nicolas Seiwald, 11 Brenden Aaronson * Forwards: 20 Patson Daka, 7 Sekou Koita, 8 Mergim Berisha, 27 Karim Adeyemi * Coaching team: Jesse Marsch (Headcoach), Franz Schiemer, René Aufhauser (Assistance coaches), Herbert Ilsanker (Goalkeeper coach) ==Matches== ==Champion group== ==ÖFB- Cup== ==Championsleague qualification== ==Championsleague, Group G== ===Table Group G=== Team M W D L Goals Points 1 OSC Lille 6 3 2 1 7:4 11 2 FC Salzburg 6 3 1 2 8:6 10 3 FC Sevilla 6 1 3 2 5:5 6 4 VfL Wolfsburg 6 1 2 3 5:10 5 ==Round of 16== ==UEFA Youth League Gruppe G== ==Table== Team M W D L Tore Punkte 1 FC Salzburg 6 4 0 2 10:5 12 2 FC Sevilla 6 3 2 1 8:3 11 3 OSC Lille 6 3 1 2 7:6 10 4 VfL Wolfsburg 6 0 1 5 2:13 1 ==Friendly matches== ==Top scorer== Name Goals Karim Adeyemi Topscorer of the Austrian Bundesliga 19 Noah Okafor 9 Luka Sucic 8 Bundesliga.at == References == Category:FC Red Bull Salzburg seasons Category:2021–22 in European football
title: 2021–22 Red Bull Salzburg season
